name: Waterfront Hotel Downtown Burlington

reviews.text: It is really too bad that this hotel has been neglected. It is in a lovely location in Burlington. The walls in the room were cracking and in need of a new paint job. The air conditioning in the room turned off in the middle of the night. I must say that it was clean but had an odd smell. The Internet was very, very slow and constantly went down.
reviews.title: Needs a refresh!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Waterfront for 2 nights and did not experience any major problems but a few small issues did crop up. We were there for a wedding and as far as a place to rest your head it made the grade. The room was clean but small. We had our dog with us and the lower level room was good for that. There were a few surprises, practically no toilet papering the bathroom when we arrived, the door to walk outside on lower level was not working, one elevator broken (out of 2), hot tub (spa) by pool broken and the room was, again, small. Recommend for a night or two for a local event but not for vacation.
reviews.title: Decent but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here previously and always had a pleasant experience. Unfortunately today when we arrived we were told AFTER being registered that the elevator was not working and that our room was on the top floor (6th!). We were also told that the technicians were working on it. They suggested that we go have a coffee and all would be well, but they would not be pinned down on the ETA for the repair. So we drove about town, went to the mall, gave it a couple of hours and came back. That is when we found out that the elevator had been out since the morning and that first one elevator broke, and then when the repairman was working, so did the second. There was still no clear indication of any ETA, although the repairman did remove a very large and intricate looking piece of machinery. Other guests were advised to take rooms on the first or second floor, but there were no king/jacuzzi suites on the lower floors. Advising us initially (like, say, BEFORE we registered!) that this was problematic might have mitigated our displeasure, but as it was, we added 127km in 40 degree heat and wasted 4 hours, and still didn't have any place to stay. That's a lot of time and gas. While the desk staff did the best they could, they were less than empathetic with our circumstances and should have told us the details up front. Had we been informed at arrival, we would have turned around right away and made other plans. It is the waste of our time and energy that really hurts. We have been repeat clients of this establishment, but would certainly think twice in the future about trying again. Very disappointed.
reviews.title: Broken Elevator, Broken Vacation

reviews.text: Rooms were small, bedding is ancient, everything so very old. Our first room had a wasp in it and nobody ever came to get rid of it, or put us in another room. We just waited until it showed up again, and killed it. The pool had kids jumping and splashing in it every time we went down to swim, nobody monitors it at all. The staff was snooty and not helpful with any of our requests, it's like they absolutely hated their jobs. On the bright side, the view from the café was stellar, but the food was cold and very blasé. What can you expect from Burlington? There just aren't many options in hotels there, but if there were, someone would make a mint.
reviews.title: Needs Renovating

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel this weekend for a wedding. We requested an early check in so we could get changed, but on arrival at 1pm we couldn't get a room so had to change in the washroom. When we returned to the hotel after the wedding at 2am I received a room card, carried my luggage up to the 3rd floor only to discover that the room was already occupied so I had to trek back to the front desk, tired and loaded with luggage at 2am. They assigned another room, but the front desk clerk was surly and indifferent. The room inself was musty and needed upgrading. The breakfast next morning was OK, but again the staff were not very helpful. They seriously need to review their customer relations policy. I doubt I will stay here again, but as its the only hotel in that area I guess they figure they can be as rude as they like to guests.
reviews.title: Bad customer service

reviews.text: My husband and I live in downtown Burlington just down the road from the Waterfront Hotel and this is the only place we recommend to family and friends who are visiting the area. We have a one bedroom condo on the lake and therefore no additional space for overnight guests and we have booked the Waterfront several times for them.
reviews.title: Review from a local

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is on site, free parking given to guests but don't forget to display your parking pass in the window or you will be ticketed because the parking enforcement in downtown Burlington is brutal!
reviews.title: Great location but a lot of noise..
Nice stopover
reviews.text: There is an onsite restaurant for meals and probably the best patio view in town! The hotel has a small but adequate indoor pool with hottub and is steps away from the new Pier jetting out onto Lake Ontario. As well, within steps of the hotel there are many, many fabulous restaurants to choose from. Our favourite is the Pepperwood Bistro on Lakeshore, which has a micro brewery on site and several different brands to choose from.

Yes, some of the rooms are dated yet recently my guests have been getting lucky with being assigned the renovated rooms on the 5th floor. I have a feeling that the hotel is slowly renovating all the rooms. My guests have never had a complaint about the hotel and are always pleased when they check out.
reviews.title: Not bad not great

reviews.text: Yes, it does get a bit loud in the summer months at this location because of it's direct proximity to Spencer Smith Park. There is always something going on there in the summer (ie. Sound of Music Festival or Rib Fest).
reviews.title: A Good Lakeside Spot in Burlington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel due to attending a wedding at the same hotel.
reviews.title: Not a great experience for a flagship hotel.

reviews.text: Our room was situated just above the bar patio and the noise coming into the room was appalling. We did not get to sleep until 2:30am.
reviews.title: ruined vacations

reviews.text: The room itself was rather outdated. The bed mattresses were in need of immediate replacement as they had "sink holes" that you disappeared into when you laid on either bed. The pillows were a joke, too soft and smaller than a regular pillow.
reviews.title: Staff are rude!!

reviews.text: The air-conditioner did not work properly making the room warmer than it needed to be. The walls of the room were badly painted as you could see where maintenance just patched up and painted the wall rather than repainting the whole wall.
reviews.title: Beautiful View

reviews.text: When we notified the staff the next morning of all the issues, it was met with indifference.
reviews.title: Nice Room in Pretty Setting

reviews.text: I recently stayed here on business and enjoyed the staff, location and amenities. Downtown Burlington is a treasure. Book in advance as the summer is busy as it was sold out 2 of the nights I was there.
reviews.title: great location on the waterfont and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for ten days in May. We could not fault the hotel itself and would be happy to return. Our room was most spacious and very comfortable and there was a lovely view of Spencer Smith Park and the lake, including the new pier which wasn't quite finished being built. This is the reason I am giving the hotel 4*.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The only downfall was the breakfast, which we ate in the adjoining Beever and Bulldog pub/restaurant. Although there were hot and cold choices, which were nicely prepared, there was not a great deal of choice and it was all was rather repetitive. It may have appeared better if we didn't have to use the polystyrene plates, paper cups and plastic cutlery.
reviews.title: Room deteriorating offset by superb staff and nice restaurant/bar/view of the lake

reviews.text: The view of the lake and superb, friendly people are what I remembered most from my one night stay here. The only reason I didn't rate it a 5 is the rooms are aging a little with bubbled wall paper and some paint peeling in the bathroom. The beds were comfortable, the shower water pressure was great, and the internet was adequate. I don't get it when motel owners let a great place like this deteriorate. Seems to me all the hard stuff is done extremely well and it wouldn't be that difficult to make sure the physical condition of the rooms is maintained. That said I'll stay here again next time I'm in Burlington and I'm very hopeful the owners will realize the staff is doing their part extremely well and the owners should do their part by renewing the rooms. Sooner or later the rooms will deteriorate to where even superb service can't offset it.
reviews.title: Hotel facing lake ontario

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I nice hotel for a holiday. Hotel located beside lake Ontario, centrally located with eateries across the road. In-house bar serves by smiling waitress. BUT for a business travellers it is below par. The room Wi-Fi is snail pace, The only way I can get work done is to bring my note book down to the bar to surf the net and read my email. WIFI in the bar is good.
reviews.title: screwed up reservation

description: Waterfront Hotel-Downtown is a landmark in the city of Burlington, Ontario, on the shores of Lake Ontario. With spectular panoramic views and all the conveniences of downtown within steps of the hotel. A perfect getaway with inspiring waterfront parkland and trails, unique shopping, museums, exquisite dining and world class festivals situated less than an hour from Toronto and Niagara Falls.
